snippet: Wei-Hock Soon, who is at the center of a controversy over fossil-fuel funding for climate research, denounced his critics and said he would be happy to comply with possible additional disclosure requirements.
abstract: Scientist Wei-Hock Soon, at heart of controversy over fossil-fuel funding for climate research, counters his critics and says he will be 'happy to comply' with possible further disclosure requirements from journals publishing his work; he is researcher at Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics.
lead_paragraph: Wei-Hock Soon, who is at the center of a controversy over fossil-fuel funding for climate research, denounced his critics and said he would be happy to comply with possible additional disclosure requirements.

headline.main: Climate Change Researcher Offers a Defense of His Practices
